00024  *
00025  * This code parses the Freetype font outline data to chains of Blender's beziertriples.
00026  * Additional information can be found at the bottom of this file.
00027  *
00028  * Code that uses exotic character maps is present but commented out.
00029  */

00072 static void freetypechar_to_vchar(FT_Face face, FT_ULong charcode, VFontData *vfd)
00073 {
00074     // Blender
00075     struct Nurb *nu;
00076     struct VChar *che;
00077     struct BezTriple *bezt;
00078     
00079     // Freetype2
00080     FT_GlyphSlot glyph;
00081     FT_UInt glyph_index;
00082     FT_Outline ftoutline;
00083     float scale, height;
00084     float dx, dy;
00085     int j,k,l,m=0;
00086     
00087     // adjust font size
00088     height= ((double) face->bbox.yMax - (double) face->bbox.yMin);
00089     if (height != 0.0f)
00090         scale = 1.0f / height;
00091     else
00092         scale = 1.0f / 1000.0f;
00093     
00094     //  
00095     // Generate the character 3D data
00096     //
00097     // Get the FT Glyph index and load the Glyph
00098     glyph_index= FT_Get_Char_Index(face, charcode);
00099     err= FT_Load_Glyph(face, glyph_index, FT_LOAD_NO_SCALE | FT_LOAD_NO_BITMAP);
00100     
00101     // If loading succeeded, convert the FT glyph to the internal format
00102     if (!err) {
00103         int *npoints;
00104         int *onpoints;
00105         
00106         // First we create entry for the new character to the character list
00107         che= (VChar *) MEM_callocN(sizeof(struct VChar), "objfnt_char");
00108         BLI_addtail(&vfd->characters, che);
00109         
00110         // Take some data for modifying purposes
00111         glyph= face->glyph;
00112         ftoutline= glyph->outline;
00113         
00114         // Set the width and character code
00115         che->index= charcode;
00116         che->width= glyph->advance.x * scale;
00117         
00118         // Start converting the FT data
00119         npoints = (int *)MEM_callocN((ftoutline.n_contours) * sizeof(int),"endpoints");
00120         onpoints = (int *)MEM_callocN((ftoutline.n_contours) * sizeof(int),"onpoints");
00121 
00122         // calculate total points of each contour
00123         for (j = 0; j < ftoutline.n_contours; j++) {
00124             if (j == 0)
00125                 npoints[j] = ftoutline.contours[j] + 1;
00126             else
00127                 npoints[j] = ftoutline.contours[j] - ftoutline.contours[j - 1];
00128         }
00129 
00130         // get number of on-curve points for beziertriples (including conic virtual on-points) 
00131         for (j = 0; j < ftoutline.n_contours; j++) {
00132             for (k = 0; k < npoints[j]; k++) {
00133                 if (j > 0) l = k + ftoutline.contours[j - 1] + 1; else l = k;
00134                     if (ftoutline.tags[l] == FT_Curve_Tag_On)
00135                         onpoints[j]++;
00136 
00137                 if (k < npoints[j] - 1 )
00138                     if ( ftoutline.tags[l]   == FT_Curve_Tag_Conic &&
00139                         ftoutline.tags[l+1] == FT_Curve_Tag_Conic)
00140                         onpoints[j]++;
00141             }
00142         }
00143 
00144         //contour loop, bezier & conic styles merged
00145         for (j = 0; j < ftoutline.n_contours; j++) {
00146             // add new curve
00147             nu  =  (Nurb *)MEM_callocN(sizeof(struct Nurb), "objfnt_nurb");
00148             bezt = (BezTriple *)MEM_callocN((onpoints[j]) * sizeof(BezTriple), "objfnt_bezt");
00149             BLI_addtail(&che->nurbsbase, nu);
00150 
00151             nu->type= CU_BEZIER;
00152             nu->pntsu = onpoints[j];
00153             nu->resolu= 8;
00154             nu->flag= CU_2D;
00155             nu->flagu= CU_NURB_CYCLIC;
00156             nu->bezt = bezt;
00157 
00158             //individual curve loop, start-end
00159             for (k = 0; k < npoints[j]; k++) {
00160                 if (j > 0) l = k + ftoutline.contours[j - 1] + 1; else l = k;
00161                 if (k == 0) m = l;
00162                     
00163                 //virtual conic on-curve points
00164                 if (k < npoints[j] - 1) {
00165                     if (ftoutline.tags[l] == FT_Curve_Tag_Conic && ftoutline.tags[l+1] == FT_Curve_Tag_Conic) {
00166                         dx = (ftoutline.points[l].x + ftoutline.points[l+1].x)* scale / 2.0f;
00167                         dy = (ftoutline.points[l].y + ftoutline.points[l+1].y)* scale / 2.0f;
00168 
00169                         //left handle
00170                         bezt->vec[0][0] = (dx + (2 * ftoutline.points[l].x)* scale) / 3.0f;
00171                         bezt->vec[0][1] = (dy + (2 * ftoutline.points[l].y)* scale) / 3.0f;
00172 
00173                         //midpoint (virtual on-curve point)
00174                         bezt->vec[1][0] = dx;
00175                         bezt->vec[1][1] = dy;
00176 
00177                         //right handle
00178                         bezt->vec[2][0] = (dx + (2 * ftoutline.points[l+1].x)* scale) / 3.0f;
00179                         bezt->vec[2][1] = (dy + (2 * ftoutline.points[l+1].y)* scale) / 3.0f;
00180 
00181                         bezt->h1= bezt->h2= HD_ALIGN;
00182                         bezt->radius= 1.0f;
00183                         bezt++;
00184                     }
00185                 }
00186 
00187                 //on-curve points
00188                 if (ftoutline.tags[l] == FT_Curve_Tag_On) {
00189                     //left handle
00190                     if (k > 0) {
00191                         if (ftoutline.tags[l - 1] == FT_Curve_Tag_Cubic) {
00192                             bezt->vec[0][0] = ftoutline.points[l-1].x* scale;
00193                             bezt->vec[0][1] = ftoutline.points[l-1].y* scale;
00194                             bezt->h1= HD_FREE;
00195                         }
00196                         else if (ftoutline.tags[l - 1] == FT_Curve_Tag_Conic) {
00197                             bezt->vec[0][0] = (ftoutline.points[l].x + (2 * ftoutline.points[l - 1].x))* scale / 3.0f;
00198                             bezt->vec[0][1] = (ftoutline.points[l].y + (2 * ftoutline.points[l - 1].y))* scale / 3.0f;
00199                             bezt->h1= HD_FREE;
00200                         }
00201                         else {
00202                             bezt->vec[0][0] = ftoutline.points[l].x* scale - (ftoutline.points[l].x - ftoutline.points[l-1].x)* scale / 3.0f;
00203                             bezt->vec[0][1] = ftoutline.points[l].y* scale - (ftoutline.points[l].y - ftoutline.points[l-1].y)* scale / 3.0f;
00204                             bezt->h1= HD_VECT;
00205                         }
00206                     }
00207                     else { //first point on curve
00208                         if (ftoutline.tags[ftoutline.contours[j]] == FT_Curve_Tag_Cubic) {
00209                             bezt->vec[0][0] = ftoutline.points[ftoutline.contours[j]].x * scale;
00210                             bezt->vec[0][1] = ftoutline.points[ftoutline.contours[j]].y * scale;
00211                             bezt->h1= HD_FREE;
00212                         }
00213                         else if (ftoutline.tags[ftoutline.contours[j]] == FT_Curve_Tag_Conic) {
00214                             bezt->vec[0][0] = (ftoutline.points[l].x + (2 * ftoutline.points[ftoutline.contours[j]].x))* scale / 3.0f;
00215                             bezt->vec[0][1] = (ftoutline.points[l].y + (2 * ftoutline.points[ftoutline.contours[j]].y))* scale / 3.0f;
00216                             bezt->h1= HD_FREE;
00217                         }
00218                         else {
00219                             bezt->vec[0][0] = ftoutline.points[l].x* scale - (ftoutline.points[l].x - ftoutline.points[ftoutline.contours[j]].x)* scale / 3.0f;
00220                             bezt->vec[0][1] = ftoutline.points[l].y* scale - (ftoutline.points[l].y - ftoutline.points[ftoutline.contours[j]].y)* scale / 3.0f;
00221                             bezt->h1= HD_VECT;
00222                         }
00223                     }
00224 
00225                     //midpoint (on-curve point)
00226                     bezt->vec[1][0] = ftoutline.points[l].x* scale;
00227                     bezt->vec[1][1] = ftoutline.points[l].y* scale;
00228 
00229                     //right handle
00230                     if (k < (npoints[j] - 1)) {
00231                         if (ftoutline.tags[l+1] == FT_Curve_Tag_Cubic) {
00232                             bezt->vec[2][0] = ftoutline.points[l+1].x* scale;
00233                             bezt->vec[2][1] = ftoutline.points[l+1].y* scale;
00234                             bezt->h2= HD_FREE;
00235                         }
00236                         else if (ftoutline.tags[l+1] == FT_Curve_Tag_Conic) {
00237                             bezt->vec[2][0] = (ftoutline.points[l].x + (2 * ftoutline.points[l+1].x))* scale / 3.0f;
00238                             bezt->vec[2][1] = (ftoutline.points[l].y + (2 * ftoutline.points[l+1].y))* scale / 3.0f;
00239                             bezt->h2= HD_FREE;
00240                         }
00241                         else {
00242                             bezt->vec[2][0] = ftoutline.points[l].x* scale - (ftoutline.points[l].x - ftoutline.points[l+1].x)* scale / 3.0f;
00243                             bezt->vec[2][1] = ftoutline.points[l].y* scale - (ftoutline.points[l].y - ftoutline.points[l+1].y)* scale / 3.0f;
00244                             bezt->h2= HD_VECT;
00245                         }
00246                     }
00247                     else { //last point on curve
00248                         if (ftoutline.tags[m] == FT_Curve_Tag_Cubic) {
00249                             bezt->vec[2][0] = ftoutline.points[m].x* scale;
00250                             bezt->vec[2][1] = ftoutline.points[m].y* scale;
00251                             bezt->h2= HD_FREE;
00252                         }
00253                         else if (ftoutline.tags[m] == FT_Curve_Tag_Conic) {
00254                             bezt->vec[2][0] = (ftoutline.points[l].x + (2 * ftoutline.points[m].x))* scale / 3.0f;
00255                             bezt->vec[2][1] = (ftoutline.points[l].y + (2 * ftoutline.points[m].y))* scale / 3.0f;
00256                             bezt->h2= HD_FREE;
00257                         }
00258                         else {
00259                             bezt->vec[2][0] = ftoutline.points[l].x* scale - (ftoutline.points[l].x - ftoutline.points[m].x)* scale / 3.0f;
00260                             bezt->vec[2][1] = ftoutline.points[l].y* scale - (ftoutline.points[l].y - ftoutline.points[m].y)* scale / 3.0f;
00261                             bezt->h2= HD_VECT;
00262                         }
00263                     }
00264 
00265                     // get the handles that are aligned, tricky...
00266                     // dist_to_line_v2, check if the three beztriple points are on one line
00267                     // len_squared_v2v2, see if there's a distance between the three points
00268                     // len_squared_v2v2 again, to check the angle between the handles 
00269                     // finally, check if one of them is a vector handle 
00270                     if ((dist_to_line_v2(bezt->vec[0],bezt->vec[1],bezt->vec[2]) < 0.001f) &&
00271                         (len_squared_v2v2(bezt->vec[0], bezt->vec[1]) > 0.0001f*0.0001f) &&
00272                         (len_squared_v2v2(bezt->vec[1], bezt->vec[2]) > 0.0001f*0.0001f) &&
00273                         (len_squared_v2v2(bezt->vec[0], bezt->vec[2]) > 0.0002f*0.0001f) &&
00274                         (len_squared_v2v2(bezt->vec[0], bezt->vec[2]) > MAX2(len_squared_v2v2(bezt->vec[0], bezt->vec[1]), len_squared_v2v2(bezt->vec[1], bezt->vec[2]))) &&
00275                         bezt->h1 != HD_VECT && bezt->h2 != HD_VECT)
00276                     {
00277                         bezt->h1= bezt->h2= HD_ALIGN;
00278                     }
00279                     bezt->radius= 1.0f;
00280                     bezt++;
00281                 }
00282             }
00283         }
00284         if (npoints) MEM_freeN(npoints);
00285         if (onpoints) MEM_freeN(onpoints);  
00286     }
00287 }

00289 static int objchr_to_ftvfontdata(VFont *vfont, FT_ULong charcode)
00290 {
00291     // Freetype2
00292     FT_Face face;
00293     struct TmpFont *tf;
00294     
00295     // Find the correct FreeType font
00296     tf= vfont_find_tmpfont(vfont);
00297     
00298     // What, no font found. Something strange here
00299     if (!tf) return FALSE;
00300     
00301     // Load the font to memory
00302     if (tf->pf) {
00303         err= FT_New_Memory_Face( library,
00304             tf->pf->data,
00305             tf->pf->size,
00306             0,
00307             &face);         
00308         if (err) return FALSE;
00309     }
00310     else {
00311         err = TRUE;
00312         return FALSE;
00313     }
00314         
00315     // Read the char
00316     freetypechar_to_vchar(face, charcode, vfont->data);
00317     
00318     // And everything went ok
00319     return TRUE;
00320 }

00323 static VFontData *objfnt_to_ftvfontdata(PackedFile * pf)
00324 {
00325     // Variables
00326     FT_Face face;
00327     FT_ULong charcode = 0, lcode;
00328     FT_UInt glyph_index;
00329     const char *fontname;
00330     VFontData *vfd;
00331 
00332 #if 0
00333     FT_CharMap  found = 0;
00334     FT_CharMap  charmap;
00335     FT_UShort my_platform_id = TT_PLATFORM_MICROSOFT;
00336     FT_UShort my_encoding_id = TT_MS_ID_UNICODE_CS;
00337     int         n;
00338 #endif
00339 
00340     // load the freetype font
00341     err = FT_New_Memory_Face( library,
00342                         pf->data,
00343                         pf->size,
00344                         0,
00345                         &face );
00346 
00347     if (err) return NULL;
00348 
00349 #if 0
00350     for ( n = 0; n < face->num_charmaps; n++ )
00351     {
00352         charmap = face->charmaps[n];
00353         if ( charmap->platform_id == my_platform_id &&
00354             charmap->encoding_id == my_encoding_id )
00355         {
00356             found = charmap;
00357             break;
00358         }
00359     }
00360 
00361     if ( !found ) { return NULL; }
00362 
00363     // now, select the charmap for the face object
00364     err = FT_Set_Charmap( face, found );
00365     if ( err ) { return NULL; }
00366 #endif
00367 
00368     // allocate blender font
00369     vfd= MEM_callocN(sizeof(*vfd), "FTVFontData");
00370 
00371     // get the name
00372     fontname = FT_Get_Postscript_Name(face);
00373     BLI_strncpy(vfd->name, (fontname == NULL) ? "" : fontname, sizeof(vfd->name));
00374 
00375     // Extract the first 256 character from TTF
00376     lcode= charcode= FT_Get_First_Char(face, &glyph_index);
00377 
00378     // No charmap found from the ttf so we need to figure it out
00379     if (glyph_index == 0) {
00380         FT_CharMap  found = NULL;
00381         FT_CharMap  charmap;
00382         int n;
00383 
00384         for (n = 0; n < face->num_charmaps; n++) {
00385             charmap = face->charmaps[n];
00386             if (charmap->encoding == FT_ENCODING_APPLE_ROMAN) {
00387                 found = charmap;
00388                 break;
00389             }
00390         }
00391 
00392         err = FT_Set_Charmap( face, found );
00393 
00394         if ( err ) 
00395             return NULL;
00396 
00397         lcode= charcode= FT_Get_First_Char(face, &glyph_index);
00398     }
00399 
00400     // Load characters
00401     while (charcode < 256)
00402     {
00403         // Generate the font data
00404         freetypechar_to_vchar(face, charcode, vfd);
00405 
00406         // Next glyph
00407         charcode = FT_Get_Next_Char(face, charcode, &glyph_index);
00408 
00409         // Check that we won't start infinite loop
00410         if (charcode <= lcode)
00411             break;
00412         lcode = charcode;
00413     }
00414 
00415     return vfd; 
00416 }

00419 static int check_freetypefont(PackedFile * pf)
00420 {
00421     FT_Face         face;
00422     FT_GlyphSlot    glyph;
00423     FT_UInt         glyph_index;
00424 #if 0
00425     FT_CharMap  charmap;
00426     FT_CharMap  found;
00427     FT_UShort my_platform_id = TT_PLATFORM_MICROSOFT;
00428     FT_UShort my_encoding_id = TT_MS_ID_UNICODE_CS;
00429     int         n;
00430 #endif
00431     int success = 0;
00432 
00433     err = FT_New_Memory_Face( library,
00434                             pf->data,
00435                             pf->size,
00436                             0,
00437                             &face );
00438     if (err) {
00439         success = 0;
00440         //XXX error("This is not a valid font");
00441     }
00442     else {
00443 
00444 #if 0
00445         for ( n = 0; n < face->num_charmaps; n++) {
00446             charmap = face->charmaps[n];
00447             if (charmap->platform_id == my_platform_id && charmap->encoding_id == my_encoding_id) {
00448                 found = charmap;
00449                 break;
00450             }
00451         }
00452 
00453         if (!found ) { return 0; }
00454 
00455         // now, select the charmap for the face object 
00456         err = FT_Set_Charmap( face, found );
00457         if ( err ) { return 0; }
00458 #endif
00459 
00460         glyph_index = FT_Get_Char_Index( face, 'A' );
00461         err = FT_Load_Glyph(face, glyph_index, FT_LOAD_NO_SCALE | FT_LOAD_NO_BITMAP);
00462         if (err) success = 0;
00463         else {
00464             glyph = face->glyph;
00465             if (glyph->format == ft_glyph_format_outline ) {
00466                 success = 1;
00467             }
00468             else {
00469                 //XXX error("Selected Font has no outline data");
00470                 success = 0;
00471             }
00472         }
00473     }
00474     
00475     return success;
00476 }
00477 
00478 
00479 VFontData *BLI_vfontdata_from_freetypefont(PackedFile *pf)
00480 {
00481     VFontData *vfd= NULL;
00482     int success = 0;
00483 
00484     //init Freetype 
00485     err = FT_Init_FreeType( &library);
00486     if (err) {
00487         //XXX error("Failed to load the Freetype font library");
00488         return NULL;
00489     }
00490 
00491     success = check_freetypefont(pf);
00492     
00493     if (success) {
00494         vfd= objfnt_to_ftvfontdata(pf);
00495     }
00496 
00497     //free Freetype
00498     FT_Done_FreeType( library);
00499     
00500     return vfd;
00501 }
00502 
00503 int BLI_vfontchar_from_freetypefont(VFont *vfont, unsigned long character)
00504 {
00505     int success = FALSE;
00506 
00507     if (!vfont) return FALSE;
00508 
00509     // Init Freetype
00510     err = FT_Init_FreeType(&library);
00511     if (err) {
00512         //XXX error("Failed to load the Freetype font library");
00513         return 0;
00514     }
00515 
00516     // Load the character
00517     success = objchr_to_ftvfontdata(vfont, character);
00518     if (success == FALSE) return FALSE;
00519 
00520     // Free Freetype
00521     FT_Done_FreeType(library);
00522 
00523     // Ahh everything ok
00524     return TRUE;
00525 }
00526 
00527 #if 0
00528 
00529 // Freetype2 Outline struct
00530 
00531 typedef struct  FT_Outline_
00532   {
00533     short       n_contours;      /* number of contours in glyph        */
00534     short       n_points;        /* number of points in the glyph      */
00535 
00536     FT_Vector*  points;          /* the outline's points               */
00537     char*       tags;            /* the points flags                   */
00538     short*      contours;        /* the contour end points             */
00539 
00540     int         flags;           /* outline masks                      */
00541 } FT_Outline;
00542 
00543 #endif
00544 
00545 /***//*
00546 from: http://www.freetype.org/freetype2/docs/glyphs/glyphs-6.html#section-1
00547 
00548 Vectorial representation of Freetype glyphs
00549 
00550 The source format of outlines is a collection of closed paths called "contours". Each contour is
00551 made of a series of line segments and bezier arcs. Depending on the file format, these can be
00552 second-order or third-order polynomials. The former are also called quadratic or conic arcs, and
00553 they come from the TrueType format. The latter are called cubic arcs and mostly come from the
00554 Type1 format.
00555 
00556 Each arc is described through a series of start, end and control points. Each point of the outline
00557 has a specific tag which indicates wether it is used to describe a line segment or an arc.
00558 
00559 
00560 The following rules are applied to decompose the contour's points into segments and arcs :
00561 
00562 # two successive "on" points indicate a line segment joining them.
00563 
00564 # one conic "off" point amidst two "on" points indicates a conic bezier arc, the "off" point being
00565   the control point, and the "on" ones the start and end points.
00566 
00567 # Two successive cubic "off" points amidst two "on" points indicate a cubic bezier arc. There must
00568   be exactly two cubic control points and two on points for each cubic arc (using a single cubic 
00569   "off" point between two "on" points is forbidden, for example).
00570 
00571 # finally, two successive conic "off" points forces the rasterizer to create (during the scan-line
00572   conversion process exclusively) a virtual "on" point amidst them, at their exact middle. This
00573   greatly facilitates the definition of successive conic bezier arcs. Moreover, it's the way
00574   outlines are described in the TrueType specification.
00575 
00576 Note that it is possible to mix conic and cubic arcs in a single contour, even though no current
00577 font driver produces such outlines.
00578 
00579                                   *            # on      
00580                                                * off
00581                                __---__
00582   #-__                      _--       -_
00583       --__                _-            -
00584           --__           #               \
00585               --__                        #
00586                   -#
00587                            Two "on" points
00588    Two "on" points       and one "conic" point
00589                             between them
00590 
00591 
00592 
00593                 *
00594   #            __      Two "on" points with two "conic"
00595    \          -  -     points between them. The point
00596     \        /    \    marked '0' is the middle of the
00597      -      0      \   "off" points, and is a 'virtual'
00598       -_  _-       #   "on" point where the curve passes.
00599         --             It does not appear in the point
00600                        list.
00601         *
00602 
00603 
00604 
00605 
00606         *                # on
00607                    *     * off
00608          __---__
00609       _--       -_
00610     _-            -
00611    #               \
00612                     #
00613 
00614      Two "on" points
00615    and two "cubic" point
00616       between them
00617 
00618 
00619 Each glyph's original outline points are located on a grid of indivisible units. The points are stored
00620 in the font file as 16-bit integer grid coordinates, with the grid origin's being at (0,0); they thus
00621 range from -16384 to 16383.
00622 
00623 Convert conic to bezier arcs:
00624 Conic P0 P1 P2
00625 Bezier B0 B1 B2 B3
00626 B0=P0
00627 B1=(P0+2*P1)/3
00628 B2=(P2+2*P1)/3
00629 B3=P2
00630
